hero.heading: Entry Doors Checklist
hero.copy: Your entry door is an extension of your home and hospitality. We designed this guide to help you find the right one. There’s even a handy checklist here for you to fill out and bring into a store when you’re ready to shop.
hero.direction: Here’s how to shop for entry doors

cards.title: Start with the basics.
cards.copy: Not sure where to begin? By the end of this guide, you should be able to walk into a Lowe’s store with an idea of what you want.

cards.title: Make your own checklist.
cards.copy: As you’re learning about entry doors, use our checklist to keep track of things you’d like to discuss with a Lowe’s specialist.

cards.title: When you’re ready, talk to us.
cards.copy: We’ve got entry door experts ready to help you in the Doors aisle. We can give you an installation quote while you’re there.

inspiration.heading: Consider going pro.
copy: Skip the hassle of needing to accurately measure your entry door.
You don’t have to worry about accidentally voiding your warranty.
A pro will clean up the mess and dispose of your old door.

outro.heading: If you go DIY, here’s how to measure your entry door.

cards.title: Width
cards.copy: Measure the distance between the edge of one side of the door to the edge of the other side of the door.

cards.title: Height
cards.copy: Next, measure the distance between the top edge of the door to the bottom edge of the door. Don’t include any weatherproofing or sealing on the bottom of the door.

cards.title: Depth
cards.copy: Measure the width of the frame, from edge to edge, across the existing door frame. Ignore any door trim.

next.heading: Learn about our different types of entry doors.
next.copy: How your entry door functions is just as important as its style. Consider how much room you need when it opens, and how much light you want to shine through.
